fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A travel feature on pilgrim trails and sites was wrong to say that St Andrews, the town at the end of St Duthac’s Way in Scotland, has a railway station; Leuchars, just over five miles away, is the nearest rail link. Also, information for a trip to Banneux in Belgium said a Eurostar ticket to Brussels included free onward travel to any Belgian station. In fact, only a ticket to “all Belgian stations” offers this option, and it costs an extra £10 (And did those feet…, 2 November, page 3, Travel). • Other recently corrected articles include: Discworld dishes Moby-Dick: BBC unveils 100 ‘novels that shaped our world’ Beware of dodgy tactical voting sites – they’re the last resort of outmoded centrists
